newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Holderbank gets 20 pct stake in Egypt's ECC.
newsitem.headline: Holderbank gets 20 pct stake in Egypt's ECC.

text.p: Holderbank Financiere Glaris Ltd said it was acquiring a 20 percent stake in Cairo-based Egyptian Cement Co (ECC) for 57.5 Egyptian pounds. The shares have a par value of 50 million pounds.

"Holderbank will fully subscribe all shares of the capital increase in ECC under suspension of preemptive rights of the present shareholders," it said it a statement, putting ECC's new share capital at 250 million pounds.
It said ECC's major shareholder was the ORASCOM Group, a construction and tourism company with a 40 percent stake.
Holderbank said it was the first international cement group to invest in Egypt.
Holderbank said ECC was building a cement plant with an annual capacity of 2.8 million tonnes between Cairo and Suez. One of the two production lines is scheduled to start operating in 1998.
